perturbation.original_text: 4) Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: 4) Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be defined in future addendums, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specified that Bravatek would receive a lead-finder fee between 10% and 20% of project revenue. The modified text removes the specific percentage range and replaces it with 'to be defined in future addendums'. This creates uncertainty as the contract no longer guarantees any specific compensation, even though the obligation to pay 'a lead-finder fee' remains. This contradicts the intention of Section 4 and creates uncertainty with Bravatek's compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_text: 4) Compensation When custom Products are designed, developed and to be delivered to Bravatek-identified perspective clients, the parties shall agree to a proposed sales price for use during the project in writing prior to the commencement of each project. 2 For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be defined in future addendums, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.

perturbation.original_text: 5) Confidentiality "Confidential information" shall mean any and all technical and non-technical information, documents and materials related to client projects of party and products, services and business of each of the parties. COMPANY and Bravatek agree to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose or disseminate, or to use for any purposes other than performance of the projects, the Confidential Information disclosed. The obligation of non-disclosure shall not apply to the following: a. Information at or after such time that is publicly available through no fault of either party b. Information at or after such time that is disclosed to either party by a third party entitled to disclose such information c. Information which is required by law to be disclosed to federal, state or local authorities.
perturbation.changed_text: 5) Confidentiality COMPANY and Bravatek agree to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose or disseminate, or to use for any purposes other than performance of the projects, the Confidential Information disclosed. The obligation of non-disclosure shall not apply to the following: a. Information at or after such time that is publicly available through no fault of either party b. Information at or after such time that is disclosed to either party by a third party entitled to disclose such information c. Information which is required by law to be disclosed to federal, state or local authorities.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Confidential information' in detail, specifying its scope. By removing the initial definition, the meaning of 'Confidential Information disclosed' becomes vague. This creates an in-text contradiction as the contract references 'Confidential Information disclosed', but no longer clearly defines what information that entails, making it difficult to enforce the confidentiality obligations. This ambiguity affects the enforcement of Section 5, particularly regarding what constitutes a breach of confidentiality.
perturbation.contradicted_text: 5) Confidentiality COMPANY and Bravatek agree to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose or disseminate, or to use for any purposes other than performance of the projects, the Confidential Information disclosed. The obligation of non-disclosure shall not apply to the following: a. Information at or after such time that is publicly available through no fault of either party b. Information at or after such time that is disclosed to either party by a third party entitled to disclose such information c. Information which is required by law to be disclosed to federal, state or local authorities.

perturbation.original_text: 10) Indemnification COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages, costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs, incurred in connection with any third-party claim, action or proceeding arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 10) Indemnification COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages incurred in connection with any third-party claim arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages incurred in connection with any third-party claim arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that indemnification includes 'costs, expenses, and other liabilities, including reasonable attorney's fees and court costs'. The modified text removes this explicit listing, only mentioning 'damages'. This creates an in-text contradiction because while the obligation to indemnify remains, the extent of what is covered by the indemnification is significantly reduced. Without the explicit mention of legal fees and court costs, it's now unclear whether these are covered, making the indemnification clause less comprehensive and creating potential disputes over its scope. This weakens the protection offered by the clause, and will contradict the definition from reasonable protections.
perturbation.contradicted_text: 10) Indemnification COMPANY shall indemnify Bravatek, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages incurred in connection with any third-party claim arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of COMPANY or breach of COMPANY of any of its obligations under this Agreement. Bravatek shall indemnify COMPANY, its directors, officers and employees, for any and all damages incurred in connection with any third-party claim arising from the negligence or intentional misconduct of Bravatek or breach of Bravatek of any of its obligations under this Agreement.
